intro: Lapeirousia pappei, commonly known as the Orange River orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in the Western and Northern Cape provinces. It produces slender, grass-like leaves and has a compact, bulbous stem. Lapeirousia pappei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
